name: Royal Decameron Beach Resort, Golf & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here and absolutely loved it ! They have excellent security, the grounds and hotel are well kept. The beds are a bit hard, but I have found that most hotels have the same issure, unless you stay at the Sheraton in Canada or the US. I have food allergies and there was always something I could eat. They have a good variety for people without allergies, and fairly decent even if you do have allergies. The staff was always pleasant. The beach was beautiful! We didn't go in the ocean, they do have some jelly fish, but we only saw 2 incidents of jelly fish stings and the staff was very helpful to those in need. You can either take or buy (cheap) a pool mattress and use it to lay on the lounge chairs at the beach and pool, and if you go to the watersports desk at the beach they will inflate it for you at no charge. They even have board games that you can borrow at the watersports desk, which is great if you have kids. We would definitely go back to this hotel. I think it is a good resort for couples, and families. We went as a couple, but wouldn't hesitate to bring our daughter with us next time. The only down side is there is a lot of stairs, so if you have trouble walking, you may want to reconsider, otherwise go and have a great time.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I am struggling to come up with any positives for my 4 night stay here. In our party 3 people needed to change room 3 times, others once or twice. Problems were rain coming through the room ceiling (two different rooms), air con not working, air con on freezing and not being able to be turned off. Some rooms were reported by our group as "feeling like being in a prison cell".Noise was terrible, I know this is a family hotel but there is no sound proofing between rooms so you can hear absolutely everything, every word, snore, footstep. Food is awful, buffet not changing much day to day, even the places that needed to be booked, which we did as a large group, were low standard. Conference rooms were not much better than a porta cabin and no windows, and poor air con control (freezing cold or not on so very hot)! Only saving grace was that my room was clean. it is pretty basic, and I wouldnt recommend coming here. you can do better!
reviews.title: never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3-days/2-nights at Royal Decameron this past weekend. We live in Panama City. As described in other reviews, this resort is about 2 hours outside of Panama City and is a popular place for locals to vacation.
reviews.title: Staying at one of villas saved this from a lower rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second trip to this resort. (We are a veteran resort couple). We came to this resort 2 years ago in July shortly after we moved to Panama. For that trip, we came with our twin 18 year old daughters. Based on that trip, we had decided that we probably would not return. I did not write a review after that trip. So this one will count for both, but focus mostly on our trip this past weekend.
reviews.title: It was a good choice for a family with teenagers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: For this trip we came with another couple and their 17 year daughter.
reviews.title: Good & Bad--2 hours from airport, hot rooms, cafeteria food beautiful grounds. Family resort for locals.
Everything you will need to know about resort and a few other things.
reviews.text: I stayed over Christmas with my mom and dad; we wanted to get away from Christmas and just enjoy each other. First things first expect at least 3 hours from landing to get to the resort, once you get on the bus their is still a two plus hour trip. The hotel has 3 lobbies and we stayed closest to lobby 3, they had everything prepared for us on arrival and we got to our room quickly. The rooms are old school and you actually need a key to get in, if you want a second key (and the rooms only have two keys) you need to leave a $15 deposit on the key. We paid extra for ocean view (don't confuse that with ocean front), it just means you should be able to see part of the ocean. They put us on the ground floor with our patio right on a main path to the adult pool and a popular walk way to and from the disco. Their was also a bright light streaming into our room right by my bed. Also the first night after checking a bit of the resort out, we had a huge black bug on the floor. The next day my dad went and talked to the front desk about moving to a higher up room with a better view. The front desk said we had to talk to our tour provider; so we went to talk to the tour provider and he said we had to talk to the front desk (he came with us to the front desk however) and finally after pushing and pushing the matter they said they would move us the next day.

reviews.title: Favourite Resort!
reviews.text: The lobby bars are only opened till 11pm and then you have to go to the disco to get a drink after that. The disco is opened to the public, so I found that they played very limited English speaking music and they often played the same songs every night. The disco was also the catch of the day a la carte at suppertime, so the disco doesn't open up till 11pm. It was an open concept building so it was nice because you were still out in the open not confined to the inside, and it was right along the ocean so the sound of the ocean was great!

reviews.title: Third time...and will return!
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful and I spent a lot of time there because the pools could get really loud. The resort has a lot of pools and just past lobby 3 is the adult pool which was nice because it wasn't as loud, but it's not very big so their isn't a lot of seating. Their also is no waiters or waitresses coming around to see if they could get you another drink or take away cups. They also say that you can only smoke on the beach or on your balcony, I noticed people smoking everywhere.

reviews.title: Very good value at the Royal Decameron
reviews.text: The spa was fantastic! I only had a pedicure, but it was very reasonably priced and they used paraffin wax. The lobby stores sold wine and champagne, which I thought was really cool because you could get a change from the very gross wine they provided. The Spanish coffee was very delicious and they did have a wide variety of different alcohol at the bars.

reviews.title: Kinda split review due to room change , better after
reviews.text: Now onto the food :( it was not very good at all. Breakfast was good because you could get an omelet and toast, and the watermelon juice was amazing. They served the same thing every single day for lunch; spaghetti, burgers, hotdogs, fries, nacho's, pizza, and a couple other things. You couldn't find a salad anywhere and the fruit was only okay. We got into an a la carte every night and even thought they say "dress code in affect" they DO NOT actually make you dress up and men don't have to wearing long pants. My family and I dressed up every night, but their was a lot of people in board shorts, hats, pajamas, and a lot of other clothes that are not considered dressy. The Italian was my least favorite, Japanese teriyaki reminded me of Edo fast food restaurant, catch-of-the-day was good but don't order anything over an above the catch-of-the-day because you can go to Woody's next door and pay WAY less then what the resort was charging. The only thing with the a la carte is that you had to still get up to get your salad (and I say that very loosely), soup and dessert. The waiters and waitresses were very unfriendly and cold, and I felt when they were walking past me I needed to move out of the way not them move out of the way for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel from Jan 16th to Jan 30th.
reviews.title: Amazing weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Reserved oceanfront and I recommend it. We were in bldg 12 room 1232 and our room was NOT outdated and rundown. No noise at night so you could get a good night's sleep. Great location.
reviews.title: Loved Panama...Resort was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Exceptional weather, not one day of rain.
reviews.title: Clean (No Frills)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Change money to US dollars in your home country...people mentioned exchange rate at hotel not good they got $65 US for $100 canadian.
reviews.title: Probably the best trip we're been on...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Bring your own kleenex and alarm clock if needed since there is none in rooms.
reviews.title: The Jewel of central america

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you are looking for an exclusive spot in the world where temperatures are a mere 33 degrees Celsius everyday and you want a resort with one stop shop the Decameron is for you! Travelling there from Jan 16-23 our group of 10 found everything we were looking for in this enormous resort. Many huge pools, bars everywhere, Casino, Disco, Jet Skis, Tours, etc. and of course a long par 72, 18-hole golf course weaving in and out of this huge complex.
reviews.title: So Nice I think I'll Go Back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to get our own Villa for 6 of us. With 3 rooms, 5 bathrooms, a kitchen, living room, lounge area, back patio and back yard, this place was an absolute diamond mine for us all. The villa backed onto the 7th hole of the golf course and was approx. a eight minute walk from the main Lobby 1. Didn't mind the walk and the location was ideal for us as we didn't have to worry about noise levels or partying since we were off on our own. Recommended for anyone in a group, you won't be disappointed. The golf course itself was terrific. A little hesitant at first since there are many homes and villas right along the course that range from 400 000 to 600 000. Didn't really want to see how much the new windows were worth. But overall very nicely kept and kind of difficult for the recreational golfer I am..
reviews.title: Good choice for sun, heat and golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did one excursion out on the booze cruise and this was probably our highlight of the week. After loading the ship, we were greeted by the owner who kept us nicely hydrated for the entire 4 hours. We dove off by Noreagas island and swam for a bit before heading out for some fishing. After a few others caught some fish, it was myself and 2 buddies turn. Happened to get the addrenelin rush of a lifetime when we all reeled at the same time.. Great time and recommended to anyone.
reviews.title: Clean but average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also made a couple walking tours to Noreagas home and also down the street to markets and local areas where we had dinner at Woodys. Great place, awesome food and nice owners who let us snap pics behind the bar and hang our Petrolia t-shirt from the rafters... ALSO I've left behind a beer funnel behind the bar at Woodys for any fellow Canadians to take part in! It kickstarts the party perfectly.
reviews.title: Probably the most fun resort in Panama

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As for the A'la' cartes and other buffets, it was fairly similar to food I've experienced in Dominican and Cancun but the daily Turkey dinners at lunch buffet were unreal!
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I would not advise travelling here in Nov as it is a holiday month for the nationals in Panama.We arrived Nov 9/11 for 7 nights.The bus ride to the resort was long , we were however in rush hour traffic.When we arrived we were checked in and sent to the buffet off of lobby 3 that was waiting for us.This was very impressive as the flight was long and only served 2 meals ( bkfst and lunch). Our first room had no air conditioing ( it was froze up ) and no hot water at all.We were given the next room to us, which turned out to be a suite(king sized bed, mini bar fridge and a larger bathroom). We were in Blg 48 , which is close to the disco and the adult pool.Once the disco was closed at 3 a.m. the building was relatively quiet.A new group of people came in on sunday.We were advised that they were from the Colon area of Panama.We were advised that Colon was a pretty rough area of panama.That is when the noise level at night went up !! A huge domestic dispute occured , with someone trying to break into a room that the occupants would not let them access.Many voices could be heard, from children to adults all yelling in spanish,,security and I do believe the police arrived.People from 3 buildings away heard the ruckus as well.This was the only bad experience we had,,for me this was a very good reason to not wear ear plugs in a foriegn country.my room mate wore her ear plugs and heard nothing,,Over all the staff were excellent and the hotel was clean.
reviews.title: Fisrt time to Panama

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a one week trip to Royal Decameron in Panama.
reviews.title: Loved Panama!.....but beware of checking any valuables on the plane!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, I would like to say that the resort is huge, beautiful and very well kept! The locals are all very nice and although they speak spanish with little English, we never found it difficult to communicate. The locals are very respectful to Canadians especially since that is how most of them make money...we always felt safe. There was a lot of cabanas and umbrellas on the beach, so we never had to wake up early to save chairs
reviews.title: wonderful holiday location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main downfall of the Decameron is the buffet. It was awful! We ran into several instances with undercooked rubbery chicken, grissely hamburgers and overly fatty tasteless food. Even the rice was undercooked! However if you stick to the a la cartes, you get a much better meal... The Thai was our favorite! Also be sure to try the Banana juice... so yummy!
reviews.title: Good value if you go off season
Great vacation!
reviews.text: Our main difficulty with our vacation/ honeymoon was the fact that our camera had been stollen at some point between being FORCED to check our carry on luggage in toronto to receiving our bagage in Panama City airport. We flew with Canjet through Nolitours. We had originally thought that since the camera case was still in the bag, that maybe security had searched our bag and it had somehow fallen out!... but than we ran into 2 other couples on our same flight that also had their camera stollen and the case left behind! Shocking!! Anyway, being polite canadians we don't want to blame Toronto or Panama for this problem since we really can't prove who did it.... however, it was in the hands of Canjet airlines that this happened, and they have been rude, un empatheic or appologetic and one toronto Canjet worker even said to the other couple (who didn't file a report within 5 days) that it wasn't their problem!! Unbeleivable how poor Canjets customer service was... especially with us couples who wanted to take pictures while away on our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel Nov. 09 to the 16th. From Edmonton it is an almost 8 hours flight and then a 3 hour bus ride so lots of travel.
reviews.title: Good value, real jungle, and fabulous golf, and Roadrunner tour!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is huge and it is true that there are very steep hills and lots of stairs.
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was two double beds but was clean and bug free even though we were on the ground floor. Hot water was plenty and again, clean with no bugs.
reviews.title: November 2011 - Panama Survivor!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We golfed 4 days and it was like being on our own private course. Beautiful. Cost was 149.00 for two with a cart Mon-Fri and 199.00 on the weekend. You can pay for a villa with golf included but they are far from the resturants and beach and the cost difference isn't huge as you have to pay for the cart. (80.00)
reviews.title: Great Overall Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Panama reminded me of Cuba. The people are fabulous but the food is.... well not that great. The a la cart resturants were much better.
reviews.title: Great Time-Very Safe
Excellent Value. Excellent Service. Great Beach.
reviews.text: Even though it is 2 hours from the airport, its a very worthwhile choice. Choose a Beachfront room if you DON'T like a lot of walking . Its a huge complex. Top floor gives the best VIEWS, but NO elevators- so be warned ! Lots of choices and places to eat -but food is on the bland side. Lots of bars-but booze a little on the low quality/taste side. Beer is good. Service is excellent. The whole place is SPOTLESS. And no bugs. Beach is very nice. Pools everywhere.

reviews.title: Best Bang for your Buck
reviews.text: If you move around and reach out to people, you will enjoy meeting people from all walks of life, from every country possible. Highly recommended. Even though this place is listed as all inclusive, that does not mean Internet, golf, bikes, snorkeling, etc. So be for warned.

reviews.title: Wonderful Time!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Decameron from Dec 27 to Jan 10, 2012. We had never been to Panama but had friends who stayed at the resort in 2011 and loved it. Overall, this is a great resort. It is not as large as I had imagined by reading the reviews, but a lot of walking/climbing is involved so if you have mobilty issues this is not the place for you. Otherwise, it was a great place to relax for two weeks.

reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay but don't come with high expectations
reviews.text: The check in was extremely organized and fast. Your tour rep meets you at the airport and gives you luggage tags with your room number on them. You take your luggage to your bus and it is delivered to your room. The hotel meets you at the bus with a cold drink, gives you your room keys and directions to your building, and encourages you to have dinner while the luggage is delivered. There were three bus loads of people from our flight going to the Decameron, but they have the busses timed so that only your bus group is checking in at one time, and our check in (4 people, 2 rooms) took less than 5 minutes. After a 15 hour day, it was fabulous. The rooms are fairly large, well kept and clean. The only thing you need to know is that the rooms do not have mini-fridges. You have to order one, which we had done through our travel agent. Although it was not in the room when we arrived, we requested it the next morning and it was delivered immediately. They also offer in-room safes at a cost of $3.00 per day, but the safes are small, large enough for passports and wallets, but not for a lap top. However, our lap top was in either our room or our kids' room the entire time, never locked up, and we had no difficulties. The security at this resort is extensive. Every building has a guard watching it 24/7. There are security guards everywhere you look. One day, I even saw a security guard going to every patio door of the ground level suites to make sure that they were locked. I heard that if you left it unlocked, they would get the cleaning staff to go in and lock it, and then leave you a note telling you about it.

reviews.title: Loved Panama - Not this place
reviews.text: We were in Building 30, on the third floor. This building is an excellent location, directly below lobby 2, and immediately next door to the Buffet Atlantico, and directly across from Cafe Med, which is a beach bar/snack bar during the day and an al la carte restaurant at night. The only bad part about this location was for New Years Eve, they set up a huge stage that took over the entire pool, which is direclty in front of the buffet next door, and had live entertainment and dancing until fairly late, so it was very loud. The hotel put on a fabulous fireworks display on New Years Eve that we were able to watch from our balcony. They had three sets of fireworks going off in three different locations on the beach. It was very impressive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you bought already the trip... too bad. If you did not, then DONT.
reviews.title: Never again!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The reviews are pretty accurate if you can take the emotions off the content, just facts.
reviews.title: Would go back If on a budget.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: BUT I completely disagree with anybody who states that the beach is ok or even better than ok.
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach is the worst I have ever seen. From about 2000 visitors you can see hardly 5 in the water. That's how it is bad. Stinky (rotten fish smell). You cannot see your even few inches in, water full of sand (grey/black). The waves are quite big, and I would have fun because of this but not there.
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lot of pools, all shallow, full of people with kids, even in adult only pools.
reviews.title: 45 minutes and I we left. Please save your money, you will thank me later.

aka: Royal Decameron Beach Resort, Golf Hotel
